data.scheme_name: Uttar Pradesh Electronics Manufacturing Policy 2020 - Capital Subsidy - DOI
data.benefits: This scheme provided Capital Subsidy upto 15% of FCI to investors.
data.eligibility: Units engaged in Electronic System Design Manufacturing (ESDM)
data.conditions:
Entities shall be eligible upon commencement of commercial production. Benefits can be availed on approval of application by Department of IT and Electronics. Fixed Capital Investment (FCI) includes the assets and capital investments such as building, plant & machinery. Following will be considered while calculating the FCI: 

  • Cost of land will not be included for the calculation of FCI 
  • Cost of building will be subject to cap of 10% of FCI 
  • Refurbished plant & machinery will be permitted up to 40% of the FCI.
data.beneficiaries: Units engaged in Electronic System Design Manufacturing (ESDM)
data.prerequisites:

Fixed Capital Investment (FCI) includes the assets and capital investments such as building, plant & machinery. Following will be considered while calculating the FCI: 

  • Cost of land will not be included for the calculation of FCI

data.context: IT & Electronics sector has been contributing immensely to the state Industry with the presence of companies like Oppo Mobiles, Haier Electronics, TCS, IBM, Wipro, ST microelectronics etc. and is proud of the long term establishment of Samsung, LG Electronics, HCL for more than 2 decades of successful operations in the state. To accelerate the Electronics System Design and Manufacturing (ESDM) ecosystem development, the UP Electronics manufacturing policy 2020, hereby covers the entire state and all the incentives under the policy shall be applicable to all eligible units setting up their base in UP.
data.objective:
1. To establish Uttar Pradesh as the preferred destination for electronics industry. 

2. To build a world class ESDM ecosystem in the state 

3. To nurture MSME enterprises as the growth engine of the economy 

4. To foster a culture of research, innovation and entrepreneurship 

5. To create sector-specific high-quality talent pool for the benefit of the industry
data.description:
1. Investment up to Rs 20000 lakhs: Capital Subsidy of 15% of FCI subject to maximum of Rs 1000 lakhs, shall be provided to investors. 

2. Investment between Rs 20000 - 100000 lakhs: Capital subsidy of 15% of FCI subject to maximum of Rs 1500 lakhs, shall be provided to investors in 3 yearly installments, which shall be payable after the commencement of commercial production. 

3. Investment more than Rs 100000 lakhs: Additional capital subsidy of 10% maximum up to Rs 10000 lakhs (total Capital Subsidy up to Rs 25000 lakhs) shall be given on investment in FCI exceeding Rs 100000 lakhs and employment generation of minimum 3000. This additional subsidy shall be provided in 5 yearly installments of which first installment shall be released from the year in which unit achieves commercial production at minimum 80% of its total capacity.
data.how_to_apply:
Applicant/Investors can register themselves on the below mentioned link:
https://niveshmitra.up.nic.in/register.aspx
To know more about the registration process go on the given link: https://niveshmitra.up.nic.in/Documents/UM_InvestorRegProcess.pdf
data.funding_facilitator: Department of IT and Electronics, Government of Uttar Pradesh.
data.funding_mechanism: The benefit will be provided after commencement of commercial production.
data.additional_info: Dispensation will be permitted only to those units which are evaluated by GOI for including refurbished plant & machinery and will be available for the first 3 years of the policy period.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Pan Card
2. Detailed Project Report (DPR)
3. Udyam Registration Certificate (URC)
4. Balance Sheet Details for Annual Turnover
5. Copy of approved building plan and building construction license
6. Copy of land documents/records
7. Copy of Single Window Clearance Committee approval
8. Safety Production License (Three System Certification)
9. Other Relevant Document As Per Requirement
